    • Method Detail

      • addConnectionsToPermissionable

        public SirqulResponse addConnectionsToPermissionable(Long accountId,
                                            Enums.PermissionableType permissionableType,
                                            Long permissionableId,
                                            Boolean read,
                                            Boolean write,
                                            Boolean delete,
                                            Boolean add,
                                            List<Long> connectionIds,
                                            List<Long> connectionGroupIds,
                                            Boolean includeFriendGroup,
                                            Location location)
                                              throws SirqulException
        Adds a user (assuming they have permission) to a permissionable object.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/add
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user
        permissionableType - the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType
        permissionableId - the id of the permissionable object
        read - the read permission of the users/groups
        write - the write permission of the users/groups
        delete - the delete permission of the users/groups
        add - the add permission of the users/groups
        connectionIds - list of connection ids (NOT the account ids)
        connectionGroupIds - list of connection group ids (these are groups made by the user)
        includeFriendGroup - flag to determines whether to include the built-in "friends" group
        location - the current location of the user
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • leaveFromPermissionable

        public SirqulResponse leaveFromPermissionable(Long accountId,
                                     Enums.PermissionableType permissionableType,
                                     Long permissionableId,
                                     Location location)
                                       throws SirqulException
        Leave from permissionable.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/leave
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user
        permissionableType - the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType
        permissionableId - the id of the permissionable object
        location - the current location of the user
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • removeUsersFromPermissionable

        public SirqulResponse removeUsersFromPermissionable(Long accountId,
                                           Enums.PermissionableType permissionableType,
                                           Long permissionableId,
                                           List<Long> connectionIds,
                                           List<Long> connectionGroupIds,
                                           Boolean removeFriendGroup,
                                           Location location)
                                             throws SirqulException
        Used to remove someone (assuming they have permission) from a permissionable object

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/permissions/remove.
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        permissionableType - the permissionable type Enums.PermissionableType
        permissionableId - the id of the permissionable object
        connectionIds - a list of connection ids (NOT the account ids)
        connectionGroupIds - a list of connection group ids (these are groups made by the user)
        removeFriendGroup - flag to determine whether to remove the built-in "friends" group
        location - the current location of the user.
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
